info.author: Viktor Prymak
info.description:
# Truthtable
```
Usage:
./truthtable.py [-hbn] [--help] [--bool|--numeric]
  -h | --help     Print this message
  -b | --bool     Use boolean values to fill the table
  -n | --numeric  Use numeric values to fill the table(defualt)
  -d | --debug    For printing intermediate representation of expression

Expression syntax:
  Variable name:
    [a-zA-Z]+
  Operations:
    &&  - conjunction
    ||  - disjunction
    ->  - implication
    <-  - converse implication
    <=> - biconditional
    ^   - exclusive disjunction
    ~   - negation
Examples:
    A && B ^ ~(~A || (A<=>C))
    A && B <=> ~(~A -> ~(~B <=> A))
    BC -> A -> C <=> ~(A || (BC && C))
```
info.name: truthtable
info.summary: Small program to build truth tables from expressions
info.html_description:
Truthtable

Usage:
./truthtable.py [-hbn] [--help] [--bool|--numeric]
  -h | --help     Print this message
  -b | --bool     Use boolean values to fill the table
  -n | --numeric  Use numeric values to fill the table(defualt)
  -d | --debug    For printing intermediate representation of expression

Expression syntax:
  Variable name:
    [a-zA-Z]+
  Operations:
    &&  - conjunction
    ||  - disjunction
    ->  - implication
    <-  - converse implication
    <=> - biconditional
    ^   - exclusive disjunction
    ~   - negation
Examples:
    A && B ^ ~(~A || (A<=>C))
    A && B <=> ~(~A -> ~(~B <=> A))
    BC -> A -> C <=> ~(A || (BC && C))
